fi.hu.cs.titokone
Class RunDebugger

java.lang.Object
  fi.hu.cs.titokone.RunDebugger
public class RunDebugger
extends java.lang.Object

This class produces objects describing what has changed due to the last command having been run.

Constructor Detail

RunDebugger

public RunDebugger()
This constructor initializes the RunDebugger. After initialization it waits until processor starts new running cycle.

Method Detail

cycleStart

public void cycleStart(int lineNumber,
                       java.lang.String lineContents,
                       int oldPC,
                       int newPC,
                       int oldSP,
                       int newSP,
                       int oldFP,
                       int newFP)
This method tells debugger that a new cycle has been started. It initiates parameter values and stores old PC and IR.

Parameters:
lineNumber - Line number of current line.
lineContents - String containing symbolic command.
oldPC - value of the old PC.
newPC - value of the new PC.
oldSP - value of the old SP.
newSP - value of the new SP.
oldFP - value of the old FP.
newFP - value of the old FC.

memoryFetchType

public void memoryFetchType(int i)
This method tells what kind of memoryfetch was made.

Parameters:
i - Type of fetchs.

numberOfFetches

public void numberOfFetches(int i)
This method tells haw many fetches were made.

Parameters:
i - Number of fetches.

setFirstFetch

public void setFirstFetch(int value)
This method sets the value of first memory fetch.

Parameters:
value - Value found in memory.

setSecondFetch

public void setSecondFetch(int value)
This method sets the value of second memory fetch.

Parameters:
value - Value found in memory.

setOperationType

public void setOperationType(int i)
This method tells what kind of operation was made.

Parameters:
i - Type of operation.

runCommand

public void runCommand(int opcode,
                       int firstOperand,
                       int valueOfFirstOperand,
                       int memoryFetchType,
                       int indexRegister,
                       int valueOfIndex,
                       int ADDR,
                       int numberOfFetches,
                       java.lang.String binaryString)
This method tells what was operation run and its parts.

Parameters:
opcode - Operation code of the command.
firstOperand - First operand.
valueOfFirstOperand - Value of the register.
memoryFetchType - Type of memoryfetch.
indexRegister - Index register.
valueOfIndex - Value of the index register.
ADDR - ADDR part of the command.
numberOfFetches - How many fetches were made.
binaryString - String containing operation splitted into parts and presented as integers parted with doubledots.

selfChangingCode

public void selfChangingCode(int lineNumber,
                             int binary,
                             java.lang.String newContents)
This method tells debugger that something was written in the codearea.

Parameters:
lineNumber - number of the line where something was written.
binary - Binary value written.
newContents - String containing possible new symbolic command.

setNoOperation

public void setNoOperation()
This method tells debugger that a NOP was executed.

setValueAtADDR

public void setValueAtADDR(int value)
This method tells debugger what value was found from the ADDR part of the command.

Parameters:
value - int containing the value.

setChangedRegisters

public void setChangedRegisters(int[][] registers)
This method tells debugger that one or more registers were changed. First cell contains number of the register and second the new value..

Parameters:
registers - Array containing new values.

setChangedMemoryLines

public void setChangedMemoryLines(int[][] lines)
This method tells debugger that one or more memorylines were changed. First cell contains number of the line and second the new value..

Parameters:
lines - Array containing new values.

setALUResult

public void setALUResult(int result)
This method sets the result of ALU operation.

Parameters:
result - Value of result.

setCompareResult

public void setCompareResult(int whichBit,
                             boolean status)
This method tells what was the result of compare operation.

Parameters:
whichBit - Number of SR bit changed.
status - New status of the bit.

setIN

public void setIN(java.lang.String deviceName,
                  int deviceNumber,
                  int value)
This method tells debugger that something was read from the given device. Devices are STDIN and KBD.

Parameters:
deviceName - Name of the device.
deviceNumber - Number of the device.
value - Value written.

setOUT

public void setOUT(java.lang.String deviceName,
                   int deviceNumber,
                   int value)
This method tells debugger that something was written to the given device. Devices are STDOUT and CRT.

Parameters:
deviceName - Name of the device.
deviceNumber - Number of the device.
value - Value written.

setConditionalJump

public void setConditionalJump(int whichSR,
                               boolean status)
This method tells debugger that a conditional jump was made and which SR bit was checked and what was its value.

Parameters:
whichSR - Which SR bit is checked.
status - status of the bit.

setSVCOperation

public void setSVCOperation(int operation)
This method tells debugger which SVC operation was done.

Parameters:
operation - Int containing operation type.

setSubOperation

public void setSubOperation(boolean type)
This method tells debugger if command was CALL or EXIT operation and it comments accordingly. True stands for CALL and false for EXIT.

Parameters:
type - Boolean containing information which operation was done.
